experiences.name: Development of Integrated System Monitoring (OAM) Daemon
background: In a distributed environment with 16 servers across 4 data centers, system failures were often discovered late through customer inquiries.
It took excessive time to identify the cause, method, and duration of failures, leading to a decline in service reliability.
A key challenge was establishing a stable event delivery system that prevents data loss even during network outages.
The goal was to drastically reduce Mean Time To Detect (MTTD) and Mean Time To Repair (MTTR).
content: Designed a mutual surveillance architecture: Implemented a cross-VM Health Check structure to achieve immediate failure detection without Single Points of Failure (SPOF).
Built a Failover System: Designed automatic reloading upon detecting critical process errors, significantly improving MTTR.
Developed an Integrity Monitoring Agent: Prevented deployment-related failures by detecting real-time changes and mismatches in core configuration files (Properties).
Identified event loss issues during network disconnects and introduced an Event Queue (Failed Query) mechanism to queue failed events and automatically retransmit them upon recovery.
result: Achieved 99.9% availability in a server environment processing 6,000+ TPS with 300,000 users.
Maintained an event delivery failure rate of under 5% even in unstable network environments.

experiences.name: Wildfire Monitoring PoC using CNN Models
background: Aimed to validate the concept (PoC) of CNN-based (YOLOv8, MobileNet, etc.) wildfire detection models and evaluate feasibility for actual service.
Started the project as a new technical challenge with no prior domain experience in CNNs.
content: Prioritized acquiring minimum viable knowledge to request mentoring from AI experts.
Learned the entire process of CNN model implementation and serving within a short period through active mentoring and research.
Improved accuracy to over 70% by repeating model comparison and hyperparameter tuning to solve detection performance issues.
Researched various architectures to address serving API TPS issues, ultimately improving TPS by over 180% through structural optimization.

experiences.name: Establishment of CI/CD Pipeline
background: The goal was to resolve structural inefficiencies across the development process, such as frequent deployment failures, repetitive manual work, and slowdowns due to technical debt.
content: Analyzed team-level development processes and collected improvement requirements through colleague interviews prior to adoption.
Designed and built a GitLab Native CI/CD pipeline based on GitLab Runner, GitLab Image Registry, and Kubernetes.
Automated the Build-Test-Deploy process and improved development efficiency by establishing test environments and defining development conventions.
result: Led the improvement of in-house development productivity.
Reduced deployment time by 30% and established a periodic, stable deployment system.
Peer Feedback: 'Adapting wasn't difficult, and work efficiency has increased significantly.'

content: Developed core authentication/authorization functions based on Spring Security (Login, Token issuance/refresh, Session/Token management).
Designed a dynamic authorization process and hierarchical permission model; built an RBAC (Role-Based Access Control) system.
Established systems for user lifecycle management, permission assignment, and logging of access & system errors.
